title: 106_s630
content: TRANSFER OF RESPONSIBILITY FOR OPERATION AND MAINTENANCE OF THE FLATHEAD IRRIGATION PROJECT, MONTANA. The purpose of this Act is to preserve family farms and ranches in Montana by transferring responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project without affecting water rights negotiations. Definitions include terms like contract, irrigation district, and project related to the Act. The Act aims to transfer responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district within a year. The project includes the Irrigation Division constructed under specific Acts, and the Secretary will offer a contract for the district to manage the project. The Act transfers responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district, including rights and powers exercised by the Secretary. The contract provisions ensure trust responsibilities to the Tribe, maintenance of instream flows, and fulfillment of obligations. The Act transfers responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district, including rights and powers. The district must ensure obligations are continued, amend repayment contracts, and provide for revocation if necessary. The Act transfers responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district, including rights and powers. The district must ensure obligations are continued, amend repayment contracts, and provide for revocation if necessary. Revenues from the Power Division will not cover Irrigation Division costs, and the contract can be revoked if the district damages tribal trust assets knowingly. Operation of the project as per the Bureau of Indian Affairs plan is presumed to protect tribal trust assets. The Act transfers responsibility for the Flathead Irrigation Project to the irrigation district, including rights and powers. The Secretary shall negotiate a contract within 1 year, and transfer ownership of equipment and supplies to the district. Any changes in operation must be adhered to, and revocation is possible if tribal trust assets are knowingly damaged. Under the contract, the Secretary transfers ownership of equipment and supplies to the irrigation district, excluding real property and water rights. The Act does not impact water rights negotiations between Montana, the United States, and the Tribe.
